text:
Kris Kelmi (real name Anatoli Arievich Kelmi (; 21 April 1955 – 1 January 2019) was a Soviet and Russian rock and pop musician and composer. He was a member of the musical groups "Leap Summer" and "Autograph". His most well-known songs: "Night Rendezvous", "Closing the Ring", and "Tired Taxi".
Kelmi was born in Moscow. He died on 1 January 2019 from cardiac arrest caused by alcoholism at his home in Moscow Oblast at the age of 63.
